009package imagingbook.common.color;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012
013import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
014
015/**
016 * This class defines static methods for manipulating and converting RGB colors.
017 * @author WB
018 *
019 */
020public abstract class RgbUtils {
021        
022        private RgbUtils() {}
023
024        /**
025         * Converts the given integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color
026         * to a 3-element {@code int[]} with components red, green and blue.
027         * 
028         * @param argb integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color in ARGB format
029         * @return {@code int[]} with R, G, B components
030         */
031        public static int[] intToRgb(int argb) {
032                int[] RGB = new int[3];
033                intToRgb(argb, RGB);
034                return RGB;
035        }
036        
037        /**
038         * Converts the given integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color
039         * to a 3-element {@code int[]} with components red, green and blue.
040         * Fills the specified {@code int[]}, nothing is returned.
041         * 
042         * @param argb integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color in ARGB format
043         * @param RGB {@code int[]} with R, G, B components
044         */
045        public static void intToRgb(int argb, int[] RGB) {
046                RGB[0] = ((argb >> 16) & 0xFF);
047                RGB[1] = ((argb >> 8) & 0xFF);
048                RGB[2] = (argb & 0xFF);
049        }
050
051        /**
052         * Encodes the given RGB component values into a single 32-bit
053         * {@code int} value in ARGB format (with transparency A set to zero).
054         * @param RGB {@code int[]} with R, G, B components
055         * @return integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color in ARGB format
056         */
057        public static int rgbToInt(int... RGB) {
058                return ((RGB[0] & 0xff)<<16) | ((RGB[1] & 0xff)<<8) | RGB[2] & 0xff;
059        }
060        
061//      public static int rgbToInt(int red, int grn, int blu) {
062//              return ((red & 0xff)<<16) | ((grn & 0xff)<<8) | blu & 0xff;
063//      }
064        
065        
066        // -------------------------------------------------------------
067        
068        /**
069         * Converts integer RGB values (with components assumed to be in [0,255])
070         * to float values in [0,1].
071         * 
072         * @param RGB a sequence of R,G,B values or {@code int[]}
073         * @return the RGB values normalized to [0,1]
074         */
075        public static float[] normalize(int... RGB) {
076                float[] rgb = {RGB[0]/255f, RGB[1]/255f, RGB[2]/255f};
077                return rgb;
078        }
079        
080        /**
081         * Converts float RGB values (with components assumed to be in [0,1]) to integer values
082         * in [0,255].
083         * 
084         * @param rgb RGB float values in [0,1]
085         * @return RGB integer values in [0,255]
086         */
087        public static int[] unnormalize(float[] rgb) {
088                int[] RGB = new int[3];
089                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {                   
090                        RGB[i] = Math.round(rgb[i] * 255f);
091                        if (RGB[i] < 0)
092                                RGB[i] = 0;
093                        else if (RGB[i] > 255)
094                                RGB[i] = 255;
095                }
096                return RGB;
097        }
098                
099        // -------------------------------------------------------------
100
101        /**
102         * Interpolates linearly between two specified colors.
103         * @param ca first color (to be interpolated from)
104         * @param cb second color (to be interpolated to)
105         * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
106         * @return the interpolated color
107         */
108        public static Color interpolate(Color ca, Color cb, double t) {
109                if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
110                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
111                }
112                float[] a = ca.getRGBColorComponents(null);
113                float[] b = cb.getRGBColorComponents(null);
114                float[] c = Matrix.lerp(a, b, (float) t);
115                return new Color(c[0], c[1], c[2]);
116        }
117
118        /**
119         * Interpolates linearly between the colors in the specified color palette.
120         * The interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1]. If 0, the first palette color
121         * is returned, if 1 the last color.
122         * @param palette an array of colors (at least 2)
123         * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
124         * @return the interpolated color
125         */
126        public static Color interpolate(Color[] palette, double t) {
127                if (palette.length < 2) {
128                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("length of color palette must be at least 2 but is " + palette.length);
129                }
130                if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
131                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
132                }
133                final int n = palette.length;
134                double x = t * (n - 1);                 // x = 0,...,n-1 (float palette index)
135                int lo = (int) Math.floor(x);   // lower palette color index
136                int hi = (int) Math.ceil(x);    // upper palette color index
137                return interpolate(palette[lo], palette[hi], x - lo);
138        }
139
140}
